intro: Memora axillaris, commonly known as the axillary memora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, velvety texture. Memora axillaris is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
